annotation.TEXT: Ha! The koopduder on the right was too busy trying to hug me and got clobbered!
1-2's secret exit unlocks 1-A.
Clearing 8-3 unlocks 8-4.
4-1's normal exit unlocks 4-2, and 4-1's secret exit unlocks 4-A.
Oh, and this is interesting. Watch this Rex.
Whoa! How did that bullet not hit me?
4-2's secret exit also leads to 4-B (but I must get this secret exit anyway), and 4-2's normal exit unlocks 4-3.
Also, in levels with secret exits, I've added a key and keyhole, so I can quickly get that, of course.
3-1's normal exit unlocks 3-2 (which I won't enter), and 3-1's secret exit unlocks 3-A (which I also won't enter).
Well, don't panic. If I was truly stuck here, I would've gone back and removed the auto-scrolling sprite.
So, which of these 24 levels will win the vote? And, what other bonus stuff am I planning to do with Super Marina World? Find out next time! To be continued...
And, from this point forward, there will be no further speeding up of the footage for the rest of the video, because...
Now, clearing 7-B unlocks a path to 3-3, so if I had already revealed 3-3 from playing world 3 normally, I wouldn't have entered 7-B at all.
Now, up next is 6-B.
Now, clearing 2-6 unlocks 3-1, which I might get back to later, but I'm going to leave 3-1 unplayed for the moment. Now, let's go back to 2-A.

Oh, you're freaking kidding me. Any annotations that I add when I'm less than 48 seconds away from the end of the video have their start time automatically pushed back to exactly 48 seconds away from the end.
Okay, let's resume course, where I will indeed go straight into world 5 now. Clearing 5-1 unlocks 5-2. (Hmm... I put two cement blocks there for some reason, but I only needed the usual one.)
Now, for world 7-7, I ran into a slight snag with the goal sphere...
I couldn't see any harm with leaving the auto-scrolling sprite alone in this level, but now my victory march won't end! Is this normal?
Now, you know how in ♥-2, pretty much every sprite looks like a mushroom? Well, watch closely just as I begin the level. I'll even slow it down for you to see better.
2-4's normal exit unlocks 2-5, and 2-4's secret exit unlocks 9-2 (which I won't be entering).
6-B's normal exit unlocks 6-6 (which I won't enter), and 6-B's secret exit leads back to 9-6 (which I also won't enter).
Would anyone care to translate all that Japanese that appeared there? Or is it all just gibberish? I wonder what caused that to happen? Well, anyway, clearing 5-6 unlocks 6-1.
6-2's secret exit unlocks 6-A (which I won't enter), and 6-2's normal exit unlocks 6-3.
...I do believe this is the last exit I'm going to get! So, I am done!
Clearing 7-4 unlocks 7-5.
And, clearing 8-4 unlocks 8-5, Bowser's Castle.
7-3's normal exit unlocks 7-4, and 7-3's secret exit unlocks 9-7 (which I won't enter).
Okay, now I'm going to jump to world 7. 7-1's normal exit unlocks 7-2, and 7-1's secret exit unlocks 7-A (which I won't enter).
Okay, here's something to point out. In certain levels, I've made an addition (usually a cement block like this) to prevent me from being Kaizo trapped when I grab the goal sphere.
Why, world 9 of course! I wouldn't want to play most of the world 9 levels, but 9-8 is special.
Ah, and now the victory march comes to an end as I get shoved off the left side of the screen, which strangely doesn't kill me.
2-5's normal exit unlocks 2-6, and 2-5's secret exit unlocks 2-C (which I won't be entering).
Now, pay close attention to the whole screen as I'm clearing 5-6 here. Something odd happens when the bonus tally appears.

So, no matter where I actually am in the video, if I'm too close to the end and add an annotation, the start time becomes 15:11.9 (because this video's length in 15:59.9), instead of let's say... 15:24.0, which further increases my hassle, because I now have to adjust BOTH the start time and end time of annotations near the end of the video!

Oh, my god! Seriously, YouTube! I have almost no use for 48-second long annotations, and in the rare cases that I'd want an annotation of such a length, I'd just make the necessary adjustments to the start/end times myself! So, again I say... Why the crap did you set the default length to 48 seconds?!?!
Alright, so clearing ♥-2 unlocks ♥-3.

Now, I suppose I didn't have to actually play 3-5 or 3-6, because doing so didn't increase the total number of available unplayed levels, but I decided to anyway, since I want to unlock as many levels as I possibly can without harming the main objective.
Maybe I should've increased the footage's speed up rate for this part.
Okay, so let's get started with world 1-1. Now, since I don't care to play through these levels in their entirety again, I've gone ahead and made some modifications...
8-A's secret exit unlocks 9-8 (which I'll get to in a moment), and 8-A's normal exit unlocks 8-B.
And now, let's start touring the available unplayed levels for realsies!
And, that's all I'm doing with world 6. So, what's left? Well, I haven't visited 3-1 yet, and of course, I've gotta visit the ever popular 3-1!
Another thing to point out here: In many levels with automatic scrolling, I've removed the auto-scrolling sprite, because otherwise, it could end up being a problem.
Okay, back to world 7. Clearing 7-6 unlocks 7-7.
Clearing 6-3 unlocks 6-4.
And, clearing 8-C unlocks 8-D, Careless Bowser. Now, where do I go next?
1-A's normal exit unlocks 1-5, and 1-A's secret exit unlocks 9-1 (I won't enter 9-1).

Now, 2-B is another level where I removed the auto-scrolling sprite. In addition, if I put a key and keyhole into a level, I usually won't need to add a cement block to guard me from pits, because the key will cover that just fine in most cases.
7-5's normal exit unlocks 7-6, and 7-5's secret exit unlocks 7-B.
The goal sphere sure looks weird in the Yoshi's House sprite tileset. Alright, so clearing 1-House unlocks 1-♥.
FREAKING YOUTUBE!!!
Oh, and I guess I'll grab these capes while I'm here, since they're right there.
4-A's secret exit unlocks 7-1 (which I'll get to later), and 4-A's normal exit unlocks 4-B (which I won't enter).
Clearing 5-A unlocks 9-5 (which I won't enter). If I had played 9-6 to unlock 9-5 instead, then I wouldn't have entered 5-A at all.
Clearing 1-1 unlocks 1-2.
Yep, I'm still caped, so that bullet indeed just failed to hit me!
What in the world? But, wait. It gets better.
Alright, so let's return to the beginning of the game and then start going over the available unplayed levels!
Clearing 8-B unlocks 8-C.
This setup ends up working fine.
Clearing 2-A unlocks 2-B.

2-5's secret exit unlocks 5-1, and 2-5's normal exit unlocks 1-4 (which I won't be entering). Now, this is neat, because now 1-4 has been opened from an unusual direction, without me having to play 1-3 first. Clever things like this are quite useful in increasing the number of available unplayed levels.

Now, let's return to 4-5. 4-5's normal exit unlocks 4-1 (and the "center of the universe" non-level spot), while 4-5's secret exit unlocks 4-C (which I won't enter). Unfortunately, some of the path oddities have been fixed, so I can't walk over unrevealed paths from the "center of the universe" tile now. Oh, well. I'll make do with what I can do.
6-4's secret exit unlocks 6-5 (which I won't enter), and 6-4's normal exit leads back to 6-3.

Now, with the current setup, she still phases through the layer 2 thing, but then she ends up on the floor below safe and sound. (Yes, I could've just removed the layer 2 vehicle itself, but whatever.)

Ooh, free 1♥P. Yeah, that's gonna happen a lot, since I have no bonus stars and will often clear levels in less than a second. Also, for levels with two exits, I must get both exits in succession, since that's what I'd do when playing normally anyway.

Now, the goal in all of this is to end up with as many unplayed levels as possible, to hypothetically maximize the number of levels for the viewers to vote on at the end of a video (this got as high as 14 during my regular playthrough).
Now, just like in 4-5's case, I can no longer travel along the paths leading to 6-6 and 6-A before they're revealed, so I can't "cheat" the system there anymore.

Clearing 9-8 unlocks the following if they're not already unlocked: 9-1, 9-2, 9-4, 9-6, 9-7, ♥-1, 1-5, 2-4, 4-C, 6-B, and 7-3! (But, oddly, 9-3 and 9-5, and by extension, 3-4 and 5-A, don't get unlocked from 9-8.)
Clearing 6-1 unlocks 6-2.
Clearing ♥-1 unlocks ♥-2.
Yes, that's a ton of unlocks from one level! Now, I've already been to a few of those, and I won't be entering most of the others, but ♥-1 and 6-B are certainly fair game!
Clearing 2-3 unlocks 2-4. Oh, and in vertical levels, I don't have to worry about potential Kaizo traps, since the action freezes instantly upon me touching the goal sphere.
Okay, so back in world 5, 5-5's normal exit unlocks 5-6, and 5-5's secret exit unlocks 5-A.
This allows me to quickly clear every level to unlock stuff on the overworld, which is the whole point of this.
Clearing 1-5 unlocks 2-1.
Yep, even the goal sphere is a mushroom, even though the level normally ends with a standard goal and goal tape (which I think is the only sprite in this level that doesn't look like a mushroom).
Note: If I wanted, I could've unlocked 3-3 from the left by clearing 3-2 much earlier. If I had done that, I wouldn't have entered 7-B at all.

Hello, and welcome back to Super Marina World! Now, in this bonus episode, I'm going to see just how many potential voting choices there could have been if I had played the levels in a particular order...
Clearing 5-3 unlocks 5-4.
Clearing 7-2 unlocks 7-3.

Now, if any of you think I made a mistake (besides me forgetting to stop at 1-4 during the tour, which I already pointed out), or could've done something differently to have more available unplayed levels, let me know!
For instance, I've added a goal sphere (or whatever it looks like, depending on the sprite tileset) to every level that I could potentially be playing.
4-4's normal exit leads back to 4-5, and 4-4's secret exit unlocks 4-6 (which I won't enter).
2-2's secret exit unlocks 2-A (which I'll get to later), and 2-2's normal exit unlocks 2-3.
Okay, so 8-1's secret exit unlocks 8-A, and 8-1's normal exit unlocks 8-2 (and gets a spiny to hug me).
Clearing 5-4 unlocks 5-5. I used a couple of leftward wind tiles along with cement blocks to ensure my safety here.

We'll use an empty file for this (to go with the most up-to-date overworld), and we'll go with Luica, since she got less screen time than Marina overall. And, we'll just fast-forward through the intro since it's not important.
Clearing 4-3 unlocks 4-4.

Oh, darn! I knew I was going to overlook something and not catch it until I had uploaded and annotated most of this video! I forgot to briefly stop at 1-4 to the left of 2-B back there! Well, I'm definitely not remaking this video now! And, 1-4 will still be added to the list on the right, of course.

Now, most of the blue annotations I'm adding on the right will certainly be longer than 48 seconds, but for these, I have no problem with adjusting their length myself, so even then, I'd rather have a default annotation length of 3 to 5 seconds! The 48-second long default length is just weird and stupid.

1-2's normal exit unlocks 1-3, which I'm not going to enter. I'll want to leave certain levels unplayed as I go along, because that's the whole point. Okay, now I'm going to speed up most of this (but I'll slow back down at times to point out certain things.)
Oh, yeah. And that weird overworld glitch still exists. I wonder if there's a way to fix that...
Yes, I am indeed going to count 8-5 and 8-D as valid unplayed levels for this. Now, for the southern portion of world 8...
Clearing 8-2 unlocks 8-3. Uh... But, something odd has happened here...
Okay, so first, there's 1-House... Oh, actually, I should clear that to reveal 1-♥.

Dang it, YouTube! Why the crap did you change the default annotation length from 3 seconds to 48 seconds?!?! That just makes it more annoying than ever to adjust annotation lengths, because now I often have to adjust the minutes of the end time, but doing that before adjusting the seconds of the end time screws up the start time! IT'S FREAKING STUPID!!!
And of course, clearing 7-7 unlocks world 8!
And, clearing 3-6 unlocks 3-7 (which I won't enter). Also, this is kind of neat with the shells here.
And, clearing ♥-3 unlocks ♥-4 (which I won't enter).

However, since I hadn't unlocked 3-3 from the left yet, I decided to come in from 7-B. But, I guess it could've been done either way and gotten the same yield. Now, back to business. Clearing 3-3 unlocks 3-4.
5-2's normal exit unlocks 5-3, and 5-2's secret exit unlocks 4-5.
3-4's normal exit unlocks 3-5, and 3-4's secret exit unlocks 9-3 (which I won't enter).
Now, this one was also a bit tricky. I had to make sure I didn't get crushed to death at any point during the victory march here. (Once again, I could've removed the layer 2 stuff, but whatever.)
Well, anyway, there's the grand list of 24 levels that you guys get to vote for! Wow, and I thought 14 was a lot!
Clearing 3-5 unlocks 3-6.
Now, I suppose I could play 9-6 to unlock 9-5, but I think I'll go around and unlock 9-5 from the world 5 side. But, I could definitely do it either way.
Clearing 2-1 unlocks 2-2.
I'll probably come back to 4-5 later.
Aww... He just wants a hug♥
Welp. So much for my reserve feather.

Initially, I had placed it right next to where I started so that I'd grab it immediately, but then, when Luica did her pose at the end of the victory march, she phased through this layer 2 vehicle and got crushed to death.
